image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson is called to give evidence in her trial, where she stands accused of deliberately poisoning her in-laws with a meal containing death cap mushrooms.

title.children: Erin Patterson tells murder trial about 'traumatic' birth, separations from husband

image.altText: Children stand behind a sign that reads "Stop war".

props.synopsis: After Israel resumed its bombardment of Gaza, Palestinians took to the streets to protest against Hamas – and some are willing to keep speaking out even if it means violent reprisals.

title.children: Executions and reprisals: Hamas taking action as protests occur in Gaza

image.altText: A man standing on the edge of a large grass area of a park. He is looking at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Doctors and nurses see people in crisis being turned away, patients discharged before it is safe, and interminable wait times boil over into life-threatening violence.

title.children: Omar's seen how an ED can become violent. It nearly cost him his life

image.altText: A drone hovers above a trucks trailer with a plume of smoke in the background.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's security services say they have destroyed 34 per cent of Russia's air missile carriers with a bold drone attack. Here's what we know.

title.children: How Ukraine pulled off its 'extremely complex' drone attack on Russia

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell holds out his hands

props.synopsis: The toll of repeated injuries forces Glenn Maxwell to draw the curtains on a phenomenal one day career which featured two World Cup wins for Australia.

title.children: 'I felt like I was letting the team down': Maxwell makes selfless retirement call

image.altText: Armed police officers in tactical gear stand behind yellow police tape in a cordoned-off area.

props.synopsis: Eight people are injured after an attack on a group of people raising awareness about Israeli hostages held in Gaza. The FBI is treating the incident in Boulder, Colorado, as an act of terrorism but local police are refusing to speculate on the motive.

title.children: What we know about the Colorado mall attack and FBI investigation

image.altText: Pete Hegseth scratches the right of his forehead near his hairline with his left thumb as he sits at a table near a man.

props.synopsis: The United States wants Australia to lift spending on defence to about $100 billion a year, with its Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth warning of a "real and potentially imminent" threat from China.

title.children: US demands Australia lifts defence spending by $40b a year 'as soon as possible'

image.altText: A man and woman taking a selfie on a beach.

props.synopsis: The teenager's lawyer argued in the Court of Appeal the sentence was manifestly excessive on a number of grounds.

title.children: Teen appeals 14-year sentence for murdering Queensland mother

image.altText: Jacquie Lambie speaks to media.

props.synopsis: In her first interview since the election, Jacqui Lambie has told of her flagging health, her surprise at Labor's electoral turnaround, and her determination to keep Tasmanian issues on the national stage.

title.children: Lambie's surprise at Labor's campaign turnaround

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and glasses leans down to talk to an Indigenous person.

props.synopsis: The long-awaited coronial findings into the 2019 death in custody of Aboriginal man Kumanjayi Walker will be delayed by a month, after the death of another Warlpiri man in Alice Springs last week.

title.children: Kumanjayi Walker inquest findings delayed after death in custody

image.altText: two side by side images showing a paraglider wearing a white helmet, then a black one.

props.synopsis: The ABC was among hundreds of media outlets which reported on the incredible footage. Experts say the video was at least partially manipulated by artificial intelligence.

title.children: Paraglider video out of China likely doctored with AI, experts say

image.altText: A red tractor sitting on a rural property

props.synopsis: A 43-year-old serving a sentence of more than six years is believed to have left the Lotus Glen low security prison farm, west of Cairns, on a red tractor during a 90-minute window on Sunday.

title.children: Prisoner at large after fleeing prison farm on red tractor

image.altText: A Palestinian woman in a headscarf holding a baby standing outside an apartment.

props.synopsis: At least 30 Palestinians are killed during gunfire at a southern Gaza aid distribution site, with Israel and Hamas blaming each other for the chaos.

title.children: 'Never again': Palestinian mum says Israel surrounded and shot at aid site

image.altText: Ncuti Gatwa reaches out a hand in the TADIS.

props.synopsis: To the shock of fans, Ncuti Gatwa regenerated in Doctor Who's series finale yesterday, but the surprise face who replaced him in the TARDIS may not be what it seems.

title.children: Fans left 'heartbroken' and angry at surprise Doctor Who finale

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX has edged lower after more trade war turmoil, after Wall Street closed flat after a volatile session. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX slips on tariff turmoil, Soul Patts and Brickworks soar on $14b merger

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX slips 0.2%, Soul Patts and Brickworks soar on merger
Critical mineral supply becoming more concentrated, not less: IEA
ASX marginally lower, Soul Patts and Brickworks soar on merger

image.altText: A lady puts clay on the face of a young boy as other kids watch on

props.synopsis: Twenty-five years ago hundreds of thousands walked for reconciliation. This community is keeping their spirit alive.

title.children: 'Walk with our culture': Meet the children marching for reconciliation

image.altText: The silhouette of a leafless gum against a purple and yellow sky.

props.synopsis: A vibrant aurora illuminated night skies across the country last night.

title.children: Aurora australis thrills light show chasers, illuminating wintry skies

image.altText: A close up picture of Vanessa Mbeve standing with a garden behind her. She wears a black t-shirt and is smiling.

props.synopsis: Knowing she was locked out of the housing market in NSW, Vanessa went looking for a block of land where she could build in the future.

title.children: Why I bought a $10k block of land 'in the middle of nowhere'

image.altText: Prison officers

props.synopsis: Exclusive data obtained by 7.30 reveals the extent of lockdowns inside the maximum security Dame Phyllis Frost Centre, and it's leading to a disturbing spike in self-harm.

title.children: Prisoners left with no meals for days inside Victoria's shocking prison system

image.altText: Joe Montemurro holds a football and wears a scarf

props.synopsis: Joe Montemurro correctly called the Matildas 'one of the best brands in the world' at his unveiling and begins his tenure as coach at one of the most crucial junctures in Australian football.

title.children: As the leader of the prolific Matildas 'brand', Montemurro might be Australia's most important coach

image.altText: trump claps at a podium while wearing a MAGA hat

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's team is fighting one of the most consequential legal cases in US history, but there are plenty more where that came from — 250 lawsuits are currently featuring his administration.

title.children: There's a 'nasty' new nickname for Trump, but it gets something wrong

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a black dress.

props.synopsis: An appeals court has quashed the conviction of former NSW juvenile corrections officer Nadia Khalil and ordered she face a retrial for allegedly abusing five boys under her authority.

title.children: Retrial ordered for corrections officer over alleged abuse of juveniles

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou

props.synopsis: He has chased his impossible dream across clubs and continents. Now, Ange Postecoglou has made it real by coaching Tottenham to glory in the Europa League.

title.children: Ange breaks his silence: 'I haven't got here by accident'

image.altText: GettyImages-2210994556

props.synopsis: Football Australia reveals Joe Montemurro as the new Matildas coach after a 10-month search.

title.children: FA finally reveals new Matildas coach after 10-month search

image.altText: GettyImages-2217673882

props.synopsis: Josh Hazlewood and Josh Inglis will have just six days to prepare for the World Test Championships after their teams made it into the IPL final.

title.children: Australian stars face tight turnaround from IPL final to WTC

image.altText: Four people sit at a table with white and orange PKKP tablecloths as they sign a document on a stage.

props.synopsis: Puutu Kunti Kurrama and Pinikura traditional owners say an agreement with the mining giant, five years on from the Juukan Gorge disaster, marks a new start in what has been a historically tense relationship.

title.children: Juukan Gorge traditional owners sign landmark deal with Rio Tinto

image.altText: Tobacco Signage

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns has called on the federal government to lower the tobacco excise, suggesting its current level may be contributing to the rise of illegal cigarette sales across Australia.

title.children: Calls to lower tobacco excise amid black market surge

image.altText: A woman snorkels below a turtle

props.synopsis: From rejuvenating the Great Barrier Reef islands to launching 45 new eco-tourism experiences, a bold strategy will position Queensland as a green travel destination - but the price tag remains unclear.

title.children: Queensland eyes eco-tourism boom with ambitious 20-year plan

image.altText: A police officer opens a wire gate, behind which a police vehicle is parked. Two other police vehicles are also visible

props.synopsis: A man's body has been found in an "industrial-type bin" at the rear of a business on Hobart's eastern shore, with the garbage collector telling police he initially thought he'd discovered a "mannequin".

title.children: Garbage collector finds man's body in industrial bin

image.altText: A painted face with eyes closed and a red mark on the forehead.

props.synopsis: The 100kg sculpture, which depicts a naked man and woman, upset parishioners who believed it had an "occult element".

title.children: Elderly man, youths accused of stealing controversial sculpture from church

image.altText: A rope swing hangs from a tree above a river.

props.synopsis: Authorities say farmers revegetating the banks of the Hopkins River are crucial to saving the key south-west Victorian catchment, which is grappling with the impacts of climate change, drought and intensive agriculture.

title.children: Farmers restore nature to help river smashed by agriculture and drought

image.altText: A woman with dark hair standing outside a concrete building

props.synopsis: Lauren Ingrid Flanigan was charged with murder after her daughter was found with stab wounds near Bundaberg last Monday.

title.children: Woman charged with child's murder dies after being found unresponsive

image.altText: Purple e-scooter parked on footpath with two other people riding on others.

props.synopsis: Healthcare and insurance specialists are growing frustrated at the number of e-scooter injuries presenting to hospitals, growing to 150 per month in Queensland alone.

title.children: E-scooter fatality in Townsville as severe head injuries become major concern

image.altText: A cast iron pan filled with tomatoey beans and poached eggs, topped with feta cheese and basil leaves. A vegetarian meal.

props.synopsis: This dish of spicy white beans in a rich tomato sauce is a meeting of two beloved dishes — fiery Arrabbiata sauce and shakshuka.

title.children: One-pan spicy tomato beans with eggs and feta
